10. Narrative in art and music acts as a social memory engine: by encoding shared stories, emotions, and values into form and sound, it preserves collective identity across generations while shaping what communities remember and imagine. As media and technology change, narrative strategies adapt—shifting focal points, pacing, and distribution—so each era’s stories reveal both continuities in human meaning-making and the novel ways societies negotiate memory and power.
